meanings.definition: A type of private health insurance that helps cover some of the costs that Original Medicare doesn't cover.
meanings.sent1: My grandmother purchased a Medigap policy to help with her medical expenses.
meanings.sent2: Many seniors rely on Medigap plans to pay for services not included in Medicare.
meanings.sent3: The Medigap insurance saved the day when my dad needed unexpected surgery.
meanings.sent4: Her Medigap coverage was a safety net during her hospital stay.
meanings.sent5: The Medigap plan acted as a financial cushion for unexpected medical bills.

meanings.definition: To fill in the gaps in Medicare coverage.
meanings.sent1: We decided to medigap our insurance to ensure full coverage.
meanings.sent2: It is important to medigap your health plan to avoid unexpected expenses.
meanings.sent3: I will medigap my policy before the next enrollment period.
meanings.sent4: She chose to medigap her coverage after realizing the limitations of her current plan.
meanings.sent5: Medigapping your insurance can provide peace of mind in case of emergencies.
